subject: Re: [junit] 5 Open Source Java projects with "sufficient" JUnit tests?
msgSnippet: ... Jena (jena.sourceforge.net) uses JUnit tests heavily. Dunno if they d count as good unit tests - some will be gooder than others, some of the testing
messageBody:
On Friday 24 September 2004 15:40, Harald Mueller wrote:
> Hi -
> for trying out what coverage means (first, for me ... then maybe for us?)
> with unit testing (with various tools, among others my [not yet public]
> addition of "hansel categories" of Hansel), I would like to have around 5
> not-too-small (say >= 50 classes, >= a few 100 methods) open source with
> "good" unit tests.
> I started wading through Sourceforge, but it's quite tedious ... If someone
> can me point to such projects, that would be really nice!

Jena (jena.sourceforge.net) uses JUnit tests heavily. Dunno if they'd
count as "good" unit tests - some will be gooder than others, some of
the testing code is ancient and unmodified, and the results of my
recent battles with reification are most displeasing - but there's
plenty of classes (of the order of 1200, counting interfaces).

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
